intro: Spyridium fontis-woodii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that appear in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are usually prostrate or creeping. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
